definition: To cause fear or intimidate someone, often with the intention of making them feel less confident or powerless. This term is commonly used to describe the act of bullying or threatening behavior that aims to instill fear in others.

examples.german: Die Drohungen haben sie nicht eingeschüchtert.
Sie ließ sich nicht einschüchtern und kämpfte weiter.
examples.english: She didn't get intimidated and kept fighting.

examples.german: Seine aggressiven Blicke sollten mich einschüchtern.
examples.english: His aggressive looks were meant to intimidate me.

examples.german: Die Größe des Gegners kann einen einschüchtern.
examples.english: The size of the opponent can intimidate someone.
